data.title: Autograph Collection Hotels
data.meta_description: Marriott’s collection of international, independent hotels carefully curated to leave a lasting imprint on guests.
data.text:
See for yourself what it’s like to experience something that’s exactly like nothing else.

Discover what makes each hotel in our collection remarkably unlike anything else.

Discover how the historic Grand Universe Lucca brings the grace of the past into the present.

Discover some of our most photogenic hotels from iconic casinos and rooftop pools to modern spas and marvelous views.

Find out why art lovers add The Bankside to their bucket list when visiting the eclectic area of South London.

This iconic property recently underwent a modern transformation, inspiring guests to celebrate Purdue University’s legacy. The contemporary design celebrates the pioneering spirit and excellence of the 153-year-old public institution while pulling through many of the building’s original architectural elements.

This iconic building was mapped to resemble the journey of Ivens and Capelo, two of greatest Portuguese explorers to unveil Africa. The Ivens is an oasis hiding in the city of Lisbon – but not from it.

The Epicurean Atlanta offers a food-focused destination in the heart of Midtown, Atlanta. This hotel curates exceptional flavors and experiences for those who find enchantment and wonder in every hidden corner of life.

In partnership with renowned photography museum Fotografiska, join us as we go on a photographic journey inspired by four celebrated photographers’ experience and gaze as visitor, traveler, and guest, while in residence at Autograph Collection Hotels.

Our thoughtfully composed recommendations will help inspire new trips to new places, guiding you somewhere remarkably unforgettable.

Reflecting a thoughtful combination of landscape and design, these oceanfront hotels capture the beauty of the beaches on which they reside.

These historic hotels find inspiration in, and leave their mark on, their dynamic surroundings.
